DOC.brief_summary: The overarch goal utilize randomize control design examine efficacy web-based cognitive behavior therapy ( CBT-I ) plus treatment usual compare treatment usual alone insomnia depression outcome among pregnant woman insomnia high risk depressive relapse/recurrence ( n=208 ) .
DOC.detailed_description: Depression pregnancy ( `` antenatal depression '' ) common associate acute long-lasting adverse consequence woman offspring . Insomnia risk factor depression general population , poor sleep quality link increased depression among antenatal woman . There randomize control trial investigate nonpharmacological insomnia treatment antenatal insomnia depression outcomes . Many pregnant woman use Internet seek pregnancy-related information , report preference mental health care within home obstetrics clinic . The overarch goal utilize randomize control design examine efficacy web-based cognitive behavior therapy insomnia depression outcome ( CBT-I ) compare treatment usual ( TAU ) among pregnant woman risk depression ( n=208 ) . Participants recruit nationally complete study questionnaire five timepoints pregnancy 6 month postpartum . Participants randomize CBT-I receive access 6 weekly CBT-I web-sessions treatment usual . Participants randomize treatment usual receive usual care give access Sleepio upon study completion . Our specific aim : 1 . To evaluate feasibility acceptability CBT-I pregnant woman . 2 . To test whether participant receive CBT-I show improvement sleep compare TAU participant . 3 . To examine whether participant randomize CBT-I experience improve depressive outcome compare TAU . 4 . To explore impact CBT-I birth outcome . There strong conceptual basis predict potential benefit approach pregnant woman . Targeting risk factor antenatal depression may significant public health benefit .
